title: Creamy Chocolate Banana Dream Pie Recipe

granulated sugar

teaspoons
cornstarch

large
egg yolks

Directions
Whisk sugar with cornstarch in medium bowl. Whisk in yolks until combined. Heat milk in medium saucepan over medium heat to scalding. Whisk warm milk into egg mixture and return to pan. Cook over low heat, stirring, until mixture is thickened and just begins to boil. Remove from heat and stir in chocolate until melted. Stir in vanilla and chill until cold, about 1 hour.
While chocolate mixture is cooling, make the crust. Stir chocolate crumbs with butter until moistened. Firmly press into bottom and sides of pie plate. Scatter 2 bananas over crust.
Whip cream on high speed to soft peak. Fold into chilled chocolate mixture and spoon into pie shell. Chill until set, about 2 hours. Slice remaining bananas to garnish pie and serve.
Special Equipment
9-inch pie plate, mixer
Notes
I used Nabisco Famous Wafers, but any chocolate or plain graham cracker will work.
